translated: The Paṭṭhāna Book🔽The Triad Mode of the Paṭṭhāna

analyzed: dhamma anuloma paccanīya tika paṭṭhāna pāḷi  sani dassana ttika

original: Hetu🔽Anidassanasappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naanidassanasappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: hetu  anidassana sappaṭigham dhammam paṭicca na anidassana sappaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: Cause🔽With-intimation and impinging as condition: not with-intimation and impinging.🔽With-intimation and impinging as condition: with-intimation and impinging.

original: Anidassanasappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nasanidassanasappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Anidassanasappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naanidassanaappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Anidassanasappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nasanidassanasappaṭigho ca naanidassanaappaṭigho🔽ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā. Anidassanasappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naanidassanasappaṭigho
analyzed: anidassana sappaṭigham dhammam paṭicca na sanidassana sappaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā  anidassana sappaṭigham dhammam paṭicca na anidassana appaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā  anidassana sappaṭigham dhammam paṭicca na sa nidassana sappaṭighaḥ ca na anidassana appaṭighaḥ  ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā anidassana sappaṭigham dhammam paṭicca na anidassana sappaṭighaḥ
translated: With-intimation and impinging as condition: not with-intimation and impinging.🔽With-intimation and impinging as condition: with-intimation and impinging and not with-intimation and impinging.

original: ca naanidassanaappaṭigho ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā. Anidassanasappaṭighaṁ
analyzed: ca na anidassana appaṭighaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā anidassana sappaṭigha
translated: With-intimation and impinging as condition: not with-intimation and impinging and not with-intimation and impinging.

original: dhammaṁ paṭicca nasanidassanasappaṭigho ca naanidassanasappaṭigho ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.🔽Anidassanaappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naanidassanaappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … cha.
analyzed: dhammam paṭicca na sanidassana sappaṭighaḥ ca na anidassana sappaṭighaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā  anidassana appaṭigham dhammam paṭicca na anidassana appaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā cha
translated: With an object that is both visible and has impingement and with an object that is not visible but has impingement, … (as in §1, but with the first and second terms of each section reversed.)🔽With an object that is not visible and has no impingement, … (as in §1, but with the first and second terms of each section reversed.)

original: Anidassanasappaṭighañca anidassanaappaṭighañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nasanidassanasappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … cha. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: anidassana sappaṭigham ca anidassana appaṭigham ca dhammam paṭicca na sanidassana sappaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā cha
translated: With an object that is not visible and has no impingement and with an object that is not visible and has impingement, … (as in §1, but with the first and second terms of each section reversed.) (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā aṭṭhārasa, ārammaṇe tīṇi …pe… avigate aṭṭhārasa. (Sabbattha vitthāro. Sahajātavārampi …pe… sampayuttavārampi vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā aṭṭhārasa ārammaṇe tīṇi pe avigate aṭṭhārasa sabbattha vitthāro sahajāta vārampi pe sampayutta vārampi vitthāretabba
translated: There are eighteen in the case of cause. There are three in the case of object. … There are eighteen in the case of non-hindrance. (In each section, the method of exposition should be understood as detailed in the case of the first pair.)

original: Hetu-ārammaṇa🔽Anidassanaappaṭigho dhammo naanidassanaappaṭighassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: hetu ārammaṇa  anidassana appaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ na anidassana appaṭighassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: Cause and object🔽A state that is not visible and has no impingement is a condition, as cause condition, for a state that is not visible and has no impingement.

original: Anidassanaappaṭigho dhammo nasanidassanasappaṭighassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: anidassana appaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ na sa nidassana sappaṭighassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A state that is not visible and has no impingement is a condition, as cause condition, for a state that is visible and has impingement.

original: Anidassanaappaṭigho dhammo naanidassanasappaṭighassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.🔽Anidassanaappaṭigho dhammo nasanidassanasappaṭighassa ca naanidassanaappaṭighassa🔽ca dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo. Anidassanaappaṭigho dhammo naanidassanasappaṭighassa
analyzed: anidassana appaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ na anidassana sappaṭighassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ  anidassana appaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ na sa nidassana sappaṭighassa ca na anidassana appaṭighassa  ca dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ anidassana appaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ na anidassana sappaṭighassa
translated: A non-evident, non-afflicted state is related to a non-evident, afflicted state as a condition by way of root condition.

original: ca naanidassanaappaṭighassa ca dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo. Anidassanaappaṭigho
analyzed: ca na anidassana appaṭighassa ca dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ anidassana appaṭighaḥ
translated: A non-evident, non-afflicted state is related to a non-evident, afflicted state and to a non-evident, non-afflicted state as a condition by way of root condition. A non-evident, non-afflicted state is related to a non-evident, afflicted state and to a non-evident, non-afflicted state as a condition by way of root condition. A non-evident, non-afflicted state is related to a non-evident, afflicted state and to a non-evident, non-afflicted state as a condition by way of root condition.

original: dhammo nasanidassanasappaṭighassa ca naanidassanasappaṭighassa ca dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: dhammaḥ na sa nidassana sappaṭighassa ca na a nidassana sappaṭighassa ca dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A non-evident, non-afflicted state is related to a non-evident, afflicted state and to a non-evident, non-afflicted state as a condition by way of root condition.

original: Sanidassanasappaṭigho dhammo nasanidassanasappaṭighassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: sa nidassana sappaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ na sa nidassana sappaṭighassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi saṅkhitta
translated: A state that is evident and has an object is related to a state that is evident and has an object as a condition by way of object condition … (abbreviated).

original: Hetuyā cha, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā dvādasa, anantare tīṇi …pe… sahajāte aṭṭhārasa,
analyzed: hetuyā cha ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā dvādasa anantare tīṇi pe sahajāte aṭṭhārasa
translated: As root, six; as object, nine; as predominance, twelve; as proximity, three; … as conascence, eighteen;

original: aññamaññe terasa, nissaye aṭṭhārasa, upanissaye nava, purejāte aṭṭhārasa, pacchājāte🔽cha, āsevane tīṇi, kamme vipāke āhāre cha, indriye nava, jhāne magge cha, sampayutte
analyzed: aññamaññe terasa nissaye aṭṭhārasa upanissaye nava purejāte aṭṭhārasa pacchājāte  cha āsevane tīṇi kamme vipāke āhāre cha indriye nava jhāne magge cha sampayutte
translated: with each other, there are thirteen; with dependence, there are eighteen; with decisive support, there are nine; with prior, there are eighteen; with subsequent,🔽there are six; with nutriment, there are three; with action, with result, with nutriment, there are six; with faculty, there are nine; with jhāna, with path, there are six; with association,🔽there are three; with dissociation, there are nine. … (The section is to be expanded as in §10, but with the following differences:

original: tīṇi, vippayutte nava …pe… avigate sattavīsa. (Pañhāvāraṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: tīṇi vippayutte nava pe avigate sattavīsa pañhā vāram
translated: with the faculties, there are nine; with the path, there are six; with association, there are three; with dissociation, there are nine; with the unincluded, there are twenty-two.) (The Mode of Conveying Questions is to be expanded.)
